intro: Pojarkovia pojarkovae, commonly known as the Khabarovsk bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Far East of Russia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
